Author: Benjamin Franklin
Book: Memoirs of the life & writings of Benjamin Franklin
Quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.
Tags: close, extremely, foer, incredibly, jonathan, living, loud, safran

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.

Author: Aaron Swartz
Quote: Be curious. Read widely. Try new things. What people call intelligence just boils down to curiosity.

Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
Quote:
The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers
But above all
The world needs dreamers who do.

Author: Bret Easton Ellis
Quote:
Disappear Here.
The syringe fills with blood.
You're a beautiful boy and that's all that matters.
Wonder if he's for sale.
People are afraid to merge. To merge.

Author: Laurence J. Peter
Quote: If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?

Author: Bret Easton Ellis
Quote: I laugh maniacally, then take a deep breath and touch my chest- expecting a heart to be thumping quickly, impatiently, but there's nothing there, not even a beat.

Author: Alan Moore
Quote: Heard joke once: Man goes to doctor. Says he's depressed. Says life seems harsh and cruel. Says he feels all alone in a threatening world where what lies ahead is vague and uncertain. Doctor says, "Treatment is simple. Great clown Pagliacci is in town tonight. Go and see him. That should pick you up." Man bursts into tears. Says, "But doctor...I am Pagliacci.

Author: Tony Gaskins
Quote: If you don't build your dream someone will hire you to help build theirs.

Author: Julie Andrews
Quote: In every job that must be done, there is an element of fun. You find the fun and - SNAP - the job's a game!

Author: Jacques-Yves Cousteau
Quote: For most of history, man has had to fight nature to survive; in this century he is beginning to realize that, in order to survive, he must protect it.

Author: Banksy
Quote: I don't know why people are so keen to put the details of their private life in public; they forget that invisibility is a superpower.
Tags: anonymity, fame, interview, invisibility, privacy, superpower, timeout

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: Quiet people have the loudest minds.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.

Author: Jacques Cousteau
Quote: When one man, for whatever reason, has the opportunity to lead an extraordinary life, he has no right to keep it to himself

Author: James E. Starrs
Book: The Literary Cyclist: Great Bicycling Scenes in Literature
Quote: Melancholy is incompatible with bicycling.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Ideals are dangerous things.  Realities are better.  They wound, but they're better.

Author: Seneca the Younger
Quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

Author: Mortimer J. Adler
Quote: In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Book: The Fellowship of the Ring (The Lord of the Rings, #1)
Quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
Tags: bilbo, journey, lost, quest, travel, wander

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I have no special talents. I am only passionately curious.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.

Author: Rumi
Quote:
Forget safety.
Live where you fear to live.
Destroy your reputation.
Be notorious.

Author: Gérard de Nerval
Quote: Moi ? C'est une image que je poursuis, rien de plus.

Author: Clinton Bailey
Quote:
Anyone who lives sees, but he who moves
sees more.

Author: Eartha Kitt
Quote: I am learning all the time.  My tombstone will be my diploma.

Author: Anthony Burgess
Quote: This must be a real horrorshow film if you're so keen on my viddying it.

Author: George Eliot
Quote: Don't judge a book by its cover

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: They call you heartless; but you have a heart and I love you for being ashamed to show it.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: I have nothing to offer anybody, except my own confusion.

Author: David Levithan
Quote:
I'm not good at relationships
I always manage to find the flaws
sometimes in others
but mostly my own.
I foretell the ending
then go and create the cause
save myself
and end up alone

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: I could see the road ahead of me. I was poor and I was going to stay poor. But I didn't particularly want money. I didn't know what I wanted. Yes, I did. I wanted someplace to hide out, someplace where one didn't have to do anything. The thought of being something didn't only appall me, it sickened me. The thought of being a lawyer or a councilman or an engineer, anything like that, seemed impossible to me. To get married, to have children, to get trapped in the family structure. To go someplace to work every day and to return. It was impossible. To do things, simple things, to be part of family picnics, Christmas, the 4th of July, Labor Day, Mother's Day . . . was a man born just to endure those things and then die? I would rather be a dishwasher, return alone to a tiny room and drink myself to sleep.

Author: Joseph Conrad
Quote:
Now when I was a little chap I had a passion for maps. I would look for hours at South America, or Africa, or Australia, and lose myself in all the glories of exploration. At that time there were many blank spaces on the earth, and when I saw one that looked particularly inviting on a map (but they all look that) I would put my finger on it and say, 'When I grow up I will go there.' The North Pole was one of these places, I remember. Well, I haven't been there yet, and shall not try now. The glamour's off. Other places were scattered about the hemispheres. I have been in some of them, and ... well, we won't talk about that. But there was one yet — the biggest, the most blank, so to speak — that I had a hankering after.

True, by this time it was not a blank space any more. It had got filled since my boyhood with rivers and lakes and names. It had ceased to be a blank space of delightful mystery — a white patch for a boy to dream gloriously over. It had become a place of darkness.

Author: Juvenal
Quote: Quis custodiet ipsos custodes? (Who watches the watchmen?)

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Book: Counsels and Maxims (The Essays of Arthur Schopenhauer)
Quote: Buying books would be a good thing if one could also buy the time to read them; but as a rule the purchase of books is mistaken for the appropriation of their contents.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Give a man a fish and feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and feed him for a lifetime. Teach a man to cycle and he will realize fishing is stupid and boring.

Author: Robin S. Sharma
Quote: Don’t live the same year 75 times and call it a life.

Author: Carolyn Crane
Quote: Most people think happiness is about gaining something, but it's not. It's all about getting rid of the darkness you accumulate.

Author: Gloria Steinem
Quote: Without leaps of imagination or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all is a form of planning.
Tags: dreaming, dreams, excitement, imagination, inspirational, planning, possibility

Author: Andy Warhol
Quote: I never read. I just look at pictures.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Although I am a typical loner in my daily life, my awareness of belonging to the invisible community of those who strive for truth, beauty, and justice has prevented me from feelings of isolation.

Author: Björk
Quote: I'm self-sufficient. I spend a lot of time on my own and I shut off quite easily. When I communicate, I communicate 900 per cent, then I shut off, which scares people sometimes.

Author: Herman Melville
Quote: As for me, I am tormented with an everlasting itch for things remote. I love to sail forbidden seas, and land on barbarous coasts.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: People empty me. I have to get away to refill.

Author: Edmund Burke
Quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.

Author: Jerry Seinfeld
Quote: Keep your head up in failure, and your head down in success.

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.
Tags: inequality, kindness, money, poverty, progress, wealth

Author: Werner Herzog
Quote: May I propose a Herzog dictum? those who read own the world, and those who watch television lose it.

Author: Nick Bostrom
Quote: The computer scientist Donald Knuth was struck that “AI has by now succeeded in doing essentially everything that requires ‘thinking’ but has failed to do most of what people and animals do ‘without thinking’—that, somehow, is much harder!

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: I don't care what you say to me. I care what you share with me.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.

Author: Bill Maher
Quote: Over the last 30 odd years, Democrats have moved to the right and the right has moved into the mental hospital. So what we have is one perfectly good party for hedge fund managers, credit card companies, banks, defense contractors, big agriculture and the pharmaceutical lobby... That's the Democrats. And they sit across the aisle from a small group of religious lunatics, flat-earthers and civil war re-enactors who mostly communicate by AM radio and call themselves the Republicans and who actually worry that Obama is a socialist. Socialist? He's not even a liberal.

Author: Stephen R. Covey
Book: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change
Quote: Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: Learn how to see. Realize that everything connects to everything else.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

Author: Thomas A. Edison
Quote: There are no rules here -- we're trying to accomplish something.

Author: The Dalai Lama
Quote: When you talk, you are only repeating what you already know. But if you listen, you may learn something new.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.

Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
Quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
Tags: actions, disappointed, disappointment, dream, dreams, explore, misattributed-mark-twain, sail

Author: Ben Carson
Quote: Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give.

Author: William Gibson
Quote:
The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.

The Economist, December 4, 2003

Author: J. Krishnamurti
Quote: It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.

Author: Gilles Deleuze
Quote: Être de gauche c’est d’abord penser le monde, puis son pays, puis ses proches, puis soi ; être de droite c’est l’inverse.

Author: Robin Sharma
Quote: Addiction to distraction is the death of creative production.

Author: Aaron Sorkin
Quote: First step in solving any problem is recognizing there is one.

Author: Monica Vitti
Quote: Ils disent que le monde appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt. Mensonges, le monde appartient à ceux qui sont heureux de se lever.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: I never lose. I either win or learn.

Author: Timothy Snyder
Book: On Tyranny: Twenty Lessons from the Twentieth Century
Quote: Post-truth is pre-fascism.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.

Author: Alejandro Jodorowsky
Quote: Birds born in a cage think flying is an illness.

Author: Noam Chomsky
Quote: Optimism is a strategy for making a better future. Because unless you believe that the future can be better, you are unlikely to step up and take responsibility for making it so.

Author: Jim Carrey
Quote: I think everybody should get rich and famous and do everything they ever dreamed of so they can see that it's not the answer.

Author: Joshua Fields Millburn
Book: Everything That Remains: A Memoir by The Minimalists
Quote: But even while Rome is burning, there’s somehow time for shopping at IKEA. Social imperatives are a merciless bitch. Everyone is attempting to buy what no one can sell.  See, when I moved out of the house earlier this week, trawling my many personal belongings in large bins and boxes and fifty-gallon garbage bags, my first inclination was, of course, to purchase the things I still “needed” for my new place. You know, the basics: food, hygiene products, a shower curtain, towels, a bed, and umm … oh, I need a couch and a matching leather chair and a love seat and a lamp and a desk and desk chair and another lamp for over there, and oh yeah don’t forget the sideboard that matches the desk and a dresser for the bedroom and oh I need a coffeetable and a couple end tables and a TV-stand for the TV I still need to buy, and don’t these look nice, whadda you call ’em, throat pillows? Oh, throw pillows. Well that makes more sense. And now that I think about it I’m going to want my apartment to be “my style,” you know: my own motif, so I need certain decoratives to spruce up the decor, but wait, what is my style exactly, and do these stainless-steel picture frames embody that particular style? Does this replica Matisse sketch accurately capture my edgy-but-professional vibe? Exactly how “edgy” am I? What espresso maker defines me as a man? Does the fact that I’m even asking these questions mean I lack the dangling brass pendulum that’d make me a “man’s man”? How many plates/cups/bowls/spoons should a man own? I guess I need a diningroom table too, right? And a rug for the entryway and bathroom rugs (bath mats?) and what about that one thing, that thing that’s like a rug but longer? Yeah, a runner; I need one of those, and I’m also going to need…

Author: Joshua Fields Millburn
Book: Everything That Remains: A Memoir by The Minimalists
Quote: Love people, use things. The opposite doesn’t work.

Author: Anonymous
Quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident. ARTHUR SCHOPENHAUER

Author: James M. Cain
Quote: I had killed a man, for money and a woman. I didn't have the money and I didn't have the woman.

Author: Margaret Mead
Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
Tags: activism, attributed-no-source, change, inspirational, life, philosophy, world

Author: Kenneth Boulding
Quote: Anyone who believes that exponential growth can go on forever in a finite world is either a madman or an economist.

Author: Patrick Meagher
Quote: Some people are so poor, all they have is money.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote:
Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.

If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.

Author: Hugh MacLeod
Quote: The price of being a sheep is boredom. The price of being a wolf is loneliness. Choose one or the other with great care.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.

Author: Cesare Pavese
Quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.

Author: Daniel Kellmereit
Book: The Silent Intelligence - The Internet of Things
Quote: The most profound technologies are those that disappear. They weave themselves into the fabric of everyday life until they are indistinguishable from it.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.

Author: Pablo Servigne
Book: Comment tout peut s'effondrer : Petit manuel de collapsologie à l'usage des générations présentes
Quote: Aussi surprenant que cela puisse paraître, l'image d'un être humain égoïste et paniqué en temps de catastrophe n'est pas du tout corroborée par les faits.

Author: Pablo Servigne
Book: Comment tout peut s'effondrer : Petit manuel de collapsologie à l'usage des générations présentes
Quote: L'utopie a changé de camp : est aujourd'hui utopiste celui qui croit que tout peut continuer comme avant.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world.  Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.

Author: Kenneth Boulding
Quote: Anyone who believes in indefinite growth in anything physical, on a physically finite planet, is either mad or an economist.

Author: Bruce Mau
Quote: When everything is connected to everything else, for better or worse, everything matters.

Author: Albert A. Bartlett
Quote: The greatest shortcoming of the human race is our inability to understand the exponential function.
Tags: exponential-growth, humanity, life, science, sustainability, sustainable-development

Author: Albert A. Bartlett
Quote: We must realize that growth is but an adolescent phase of life which stops when physical maturity is reached. If growth continues in the period of maturity it is called obesity or cancer. Prescribing growth as the cure for the energy crisis has all the logic of prescribing increasing quantities of food as a remedy for obesity.

Author: Antonio Gramsci
Quote: I'm a pessimist because of intelligence, but an optimist because of will.
Tags: intellect, intelligence, optimism, pessimism, science, will
